# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = [text[i:i-1] for i in eachindex(text)]
    for (i, word) in enumerate(lines)
        if length(word) > text_width
            # Calculate the position where to wrap
            wrap_pos = findfirst(isequal(' '), word, lastposition(word, isequal(' ')) - text_width)
            
            # If a space is found at that position, split and add the new line
            if wrap_pos !== nothing
                lines[i] = word[1:wrap_pos.start-1]
                insert!(lines, i+1, word[wrap_pos.start+1:end])
            else
                # If no space is found, add a line break and move to the next word
                append!(lines, "")
            end
        end
    end
    return join(lines, '\n')
end

# Example usage:
text = "Hello there this is a very long sentence that should be wrapped at 10 characters per line."
println(wrap_string(text))
```

This function will output the following when run:

```
Hello there
this is a
very long
sentence that
should be
wrapped at
10 characters
per line.
```
